summary: Requests are open! I've decided to open the ask box for you all to send in some requests. I'll be deleting those currently in...
body:
Requests are open!

I’ve decided to open the ask box for you all to send in some requests. I’ll be deleting those currently in the ask and drafts as I’m pretty much working alone on this blog currently.

Rules:

  • Will only do headcanons
  • Maximum of 3 characters
  • Only student characters. 1-A, B, other U.A students and students from other schools are allowed!
  • Older characters I am okay with are:
  • Hawks
  • Dabi (Todoroki theory is cool with me if you want something with that)
  • Shigaraki
  • Toga
  • Twice
  • Semi-Nsfw (depends purely on if I think I can do it or not) won’t be too explicit.
  • I’ll post a notice when Ask box is closed!
  • You can ask about a character to see if I’ll do them. Chances are, may have forgotten to add them here.

blog.name: talesofdark
blog.title: = リリー
blog.description:
25 | she/her/they/them | Romanian | Transmuter
INTP/5w4.
Graphic art student, I’m into metal, volunteering, historical reenactment, collecting, taxidermy, hiking, camping, nature, a bit of industrial dancing, and art. I sometimes post art, but mostly l reblog things l relate to, rant, and so on.
I am not easily triggered. If you want me to tag something specific, ask, and I will gladly do so.
l also tag: OCS- drawings of my original characters, ME (photos/drawings of me, completed memes, things l identify with), SKETCHES (things that are too sketchy to be in the my art tag), ROMANIA, TUTORIAL/ REFERENCE for art tutorials and tips, FOOD (stuff that makes me drool), PHOTOS (my attempt at photographing nature), WOW, HUNTER X HUNTER, YU YU HAKUSHO, BATOBI/B-DAMAN, UNDERTALE, METTATON.

tags: your bf has a hard time dealing with your drunk ass 😂
summary:
Kacchan: Fuck off Deku! I wasn't that drunk!
Deku: Kacchan, you came into my room and said you were 'dressed to impress'. Do you...
body:
Kacchan: Fuck off Deku! I wasn’t that drunk!

Deku: Kacchan, you came into my room and said you were ‘dressed to impress’. Do you remember what were you wearing?

Kacchan: The fuck was I wearing?

Deku: You were naked.

I'd say avatar the last airbender but he's even done that already
title: BnHA Chapter 047: Badass Grandpa
body:
Previously on BnHA: The kids selected hero agencies to intern with. Deku was drafted by All Might’s old sensei Gran Torino. Iida had a terrifying page of foreshadowing and it kind of scared me shitless. Deku arrived at Gran Torino’s rundown and possibly condemned building on day one of his internship. Gran trolled him Yoda-style for a few minutes and then when Deku was about to leave, he suddenly turned it all the way to eleven and was all COME AT ME.

Today on BnHA: All Might and Naomasa discuss Noumu. Deku spars with Gran and gets a quick ass-kicking and some advice. Iida patrols Hosu City. Stain and Tomura are formally introduced and immediately hate each other. Deku has part one of a two-part epiphany regarding how to use One for All.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 114 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • okay I’m relieved to see the chapter isn’t just going to be all about Deku fighting Gran, because as entertaining as I’m sure that will be, I still want to know what’s going on with the others and their internships and Iida and his angst and such
  • All Might is talking to his nice detective friend Naomasa!
  • and they’re talking about Noumu so immediately my interest is piqued
  • okay I shouldn’t find this image of Noumu all wrapped up like a burrito in this straitjacket so cute… but



  • there it is. all tucked into his lil snuggie there. cuz he’s evil
  • so apparently they ran a DNA test on Noumu since they couldn’t find anything from their other tests… and what?? he’s just some guy?!
  • holy shit they took some random petty criminal and fucking infused him with a bunch of other people’s DNA and turned him into this experiment
  • he’s been “bioengineered to tolerate multiple quirks” apparently, so his low brain activity is due to that
  • they can do that?!
  • hooooooooooly shit



  • HOLY SHIT SO MUCH TO PROCESS JUST FROM TWO SINGLE PANELS. HOLY FUCK
  1. NAO IS THE OTHER GUY WHO KNOWS ABOUT ONE FOR ALL
  2. some villain is out there transferring quirks to people and turning them into basically superpowered vegetables omg
  3. and the fact that they can do this implies that they know quite a lot about transferring quirks and they might have the ability to bestow quirks
  4. which means that the concept of “bestowing quirks” would be one they’re familiar with
  5. which makes this person potentially one of the only people out there capable of putting the pieces together with Deku and All Might. everyone else so far who’s noticed a connection has assumed it’s either coincidence, or that there might perhaps be some secret blood relation between them. because as far as they know, you can’t just give someone a quirk. but if someone out there did know that… Deku’s secret is pretty much laid out there for them. which potentially puts him in a whole fucking lot of danger!!
  • (ETA: yeah you’re damn right he put the pieces together with Deku and All Might lol. but I had no idea this guy’s ability would turn out to be so closely connected to One for All. honestly, this arc has its issues, but the worldbuilding here is off the fucking charts. basically the entire rest of the series gets set up in this arc.)
  • so yeah!! a lot to take in there! god damn!
  • also the idea that there are villains out there just kidnapping people and running these kind of experiments on them is really disturbing and also giving me so many fanfic ideas that I just have to push back down for now and hope that someone out there has already explored this. once I’m caught up I’m gonna go on the fanworks binge to end all binges omg
  • so now we’re back to Deku and Gran!
  • Gran says All Might doesn’t know shit about teaching, so it’s up to him to do the thing properly
  • and now Deku looks really excited in his nervous-but-excited way
  • YEEEEEEEEESSS THEY MADE HIS SUIT COOL



  • THANK YOU BEAUTIFUL SUPPORT COMPANY ANGELS
  • I hope to god they got rid of that god-awful hood – nope. damn
  • but at least he’s not wearing it
  • now Deku’s asking “is this really okay”
  • is it really okay for you to get your ass kicked by an old man, you mean? eh, probably
  • he’s worried that if he accidentally uses 100 percent, Gran will get all fucked up. okay, one, that’s not going to happen, and two, if it did, I’d be a whole lot more worried about you than Gran
  • I just realized that he’s wearing gloves now so we still can’t see the full extent of his hand/arm damage. and before that (I just went back and checked), it’s like the panels were purposely designed so that we only saw his left hand up close. and before that, his right hand was bandaged. goddamn why do they have to draw this out
  • anyway, Gran got bored of Deku’s nonsense and he’s now omae wa mou shindeiruing



  • aaaand he’s kicking him in the back
  • Deku is shocked that he’s actually fighting. he thought for some reason that it was just going to be a demonstration. I thought this kid was supposed to be obsessed with comic books. you should know the tropes better than this by now, Deku
  • and now Gran’s purposely antagonizing him, presumably to get him worked up enough to finally fight back



  • amazing how he already knew that the best way to piss him off would be to insult All Might and not just him alone
  • now he’s bouncing all over the place too fast to be seen by the naked eye apparently
  • well, you wanted this, Deku
  • he’s turning it on! “gotta will it not to break!” yes please oh my god. because that’s the already-fucked-up arm to boot
  • he’s anticipating another attack from the rear and seems to be standing there waiting
  • sure enough here comes the old man
  • uh oh



  • what did I tell you Deku. you’re 1000 years too early to ever land a hit on this guy
  • but it seems like he was able to activate the smash without doing himself any damage, at least
  • and it seems like Gran has stopped the fight now that he got to see Deku’s One for All in action
  • he’s like feeling up his arm omg
  • Deku is frustrated and says he thought he had him
  • but Gran says he saw how Deku fought in the sports fest
  • hmm??



  • whoa hold the phone. should I be mad?
  • I guess I’ll let him make his point first
  • so he says that Deku is concerned about getting stronger fast. and it’s true that his enemies won’t wait
  • oh shit



  • all of a sudden this is a fucking theme huh
  • so does he already know something about whoever’s behind Noumu, then? cuz it would be nice if he could fucking clue All Might and the rest of them in
  • (ETA: never mind I completely misread this. he’s not saying there are other One for All-type quirks, he’s saying One for All itself is still a quirk just like any other quirk.)
  • he’s so vague and annoying omg



  • SO HELPFUL. my god I miss All Might’s straightforward no-bullshit approach
  • (ETA: honestly, would it really have hindered Deku’s growth any if he’d just come out and told him straight, “STOP USING IT IN JUST ONE BODY PART AT A TIME AND USE IT ON YOUR WHOLE BODY ALL AT ONCE”? like, does Deku really gain anything here other than the satisfaction of having figured it out on his own? it’s not like he doesn’t already know how to think outside the box. but I guess I’ll defer to the wise old sensei here since it did work out okay in the end.)
  • and now he’s leaving to go buy food and making Deku clean his house while he ponders what Gran meant by his respect for All Might holding him back
  • MEANWHILE IT’S IIDA YAY
  • who’s this guy



  • (ETA: this is Manual, everyone, and he’s the best)
  • well whoever he is, apparently Iida’s out on patrol with him, which they’ve been doing regularly since the attacks began
  • what is this about the number of patrolmen being downsized? is it because they all got taken out by Stain?
  • Iida needs to get himself some contacts for when he’s fighting crime



  • speaking as someone who wore glasses for 20 damn years before finally making the switch (and also as someone who’s done martial arts both with and without them), it’s sooo freeing to have peripheral vision, and to not have to worry about the glasses slipping or getting fogged up or cutting up your face when you get punched
  • and if he’s not going to do contacts he should at least switch to sports glasses
  • anyway, apologies for that random nitpick and rest assured I am still loving the shit out of this Iida angst
  • a high school freshman thinking he can somehow take out a serial killer who’s murdered 17 pro heroes and maimed dozens of others and put even his own brother out of commission is the most shounen thing ever
  • AND ALL OF A SUDDEN WE CUT TO A GROUP OF VILLAINS HANGING OUT AT DR. NECK’S BAR



  • does he really have a human skull just sitting up there on the top shelf
  • so this is picking up from where we left off before with Kurogiri introducing himself to Stain
  • (ETA: okay, question… what exactly is the timeline here. like, we see Stain perched on that water tower and Kurogiri approaching him back in chapter 42 in the middle of the sports festival tournament. two days after that, the kids receive their draft picks, and are told their internships will start in a week. so this is now nine days after Kuro and Stain were shown to be chatting, and Kuro’s only just now introducing him to Tomura. then the two of them start arguing, and we cut back to Deku, and then the next fucking day we cut back to the villain bar again and we’re still somehow right where we left off? and then Stain tells Kurogiri to return him to Hosu, which he does, only by that point yet another day has passed and Deku’s now on night three of his internship. so basically, a total of 12 days somehow passes for Deku while all of this happens in like a fucking half hour for Stain? or are you telling me that the initial meeting with Kurogiri and Stain is actually supposed to take place a full 12 days after Stain attacked Ingenium, and he was just chilling out in Hosu City for almost two weeks and didn’t attack a single other person in all that time (because Iida confirms in chapter 49 that his brother was the only victim in Hosu)? because that doesn’t make much sense either. all I can conclude is that Stain somehow got himself caught in a fucking time warp at some point.)
  • and now Tomura is trying to recruit him. hey dude do you want to join our evil league of evil
  • Stain is flattered, probably, but still asking some pertinent questions. you can tell this isn’t his first job interview



  • so that’s one very specific goal, and one extremely vague and petty goal. covering all the bases
  • oh and he wants to kill Deku :’D
  • oh, but apparently Stain isn’t impressed by this answer. “you’re the type I hate the most”
  • (ETA: Tomura is really bad at this recruiting thing, isn’t he. things play out in almost the exact same way when he tries to recruit Bakugou later on)
  • he’s calling Tomura a tantrum-throwing child. he says bloodlust without conviction is meaningless
  • aaaaand now he’s drawing two of those bigass daggers from their holsters
  • Kuro is thinking to himself that he thought Stain might help Tomura grow the fuck up a little but apparently not. and he’s asking if he should stop Stain
  • – oh, he’s asking the Skype Villain
  • Skype Villain says it’s fine and that Stain must reach the right conclusions for himself
  • you’re goddamn lucky these guys can’t seem to get their shit together for longer than two seconds, Deku
  • speaking of Deku it’s back to Deku



  • yep, pretty much all the same things I’ve been wondering
  • apparently the idea of “loose” got him thinking a little bit
  • “!” well something seems to have clicked
  • “I was thinking of it as some super-secret, last-resort trump card.” well, that’s definitely true. I’ve made note of it before how he always makes every effort to solve problems without his quirk first
  • “quirks are just extensions of our bodies” hmm. so is he going to start utilizing it more? it’s true that the kids who’ve had quirks their whole lives use them almost without thought. Bakugou for instance uses his so regularly it’s almost like a part of his natural body language at this point



  • who is the “him” in this referring to? All Might?
  • (ETA: actually I think it’s probably Kacchan)
  • anyway, he seems to have arrived at the right conclusion, because Gran is just chilling right outside listening to him and he seems pleased! good job my little green son
  • AND HE FUCKING CONFIRMED THAT ALL MIGHT’S REAL NAME IS TOSHINORI OH MY GOD YESSSSSS. I LOVE IT
  • and that’s the chapter end!


BONUS:


  • “favorite things: being inactive” I feel a sudden surge of kinship with this man
  • dude is 3 feet 9 inches… actually taller than I thought lol
  • loving the boots
  • “some people will instantly recognize the Dagobah sensibility about him” [RAISES HAND] ESB IS MY SECOND-FAVORITE FILM OF ALL TIME, YOU’RE DAMN STRAIGHT I PICKED UP ON THAT RESEMBLANCE RIGHT AWAY
  • he’s straight up admitting this guy is Yoda I fucking can’t believe it. so great
  • (ETA: so it’s become pretty clear that Horikoshi’s Star Wars influence is almost as strong as his Marvel influence. like, even all the place names are pulled from Star Wars, which is so fucking cool. do I even have any other interests for this guy to draw inspiration from at this rate. just throw in a few more Nintendo references and I’m set for life dude.)

  • YEEEEEEEEESSS THEY MADE HIS SUIT COOL



  • THANK YOU BEAUTIFUL SUPPORT COMPANY ANGELS
  • I hope to god they got rid of that god-awful hood – nope. damn
  • but at least he’s not wearing it
  • now Deku’s asking “is this really okay”
  • is it really okay for you to get your ass kicked by an old man, you mean? eh, probably
  • he’s worried that if he accidentally uses 100 percent, Gran will get all fucked up. okay, one, that’s not going to happen, and two, if it did, I’d be a whole lot more worried about you than Gran
  • I just realized that he’s wearing gloves now so we still can’t see the full extent of his hand/arm damage. and before that (I just went back and checked), it’s like the panels were purposely designed so that we only saw his left hand up close. and before that, his right hand was bandaged. goddamn why do they have to draw this out
  • anyway, Gran got bored of Deku’s nonsense and he’s now omae wa mou shindeiruing



  • aaaand he’s kicking him in the back
  • Deku is shocked that he’s actually fighting. he thought for some reason that it was just going to be a demonstration. I thought this kid was supposed to be obsessed with comic books. you should know the tropes better than this by now, Deku
  • and now Gran’s purposely antagonizing him, presumably to get him worked up enough to finally fight back



  • amazing how he already knew that the best way to piss him off would be to insult All Might and not just him alone
  • now he’s bouncing all over the place too fast to be seen by the naked eye apparently
  • well, you wanted this, Deku
  • he’s turning it on! “gotta will it not to break!” yes please oh my god. because that’s the already-fucked-up arm to boot
  • he’s anticipating another attack from the rear and seems to be standing there waiting
  • sure enough here comes the old man
  • uh oh



  • what did I tell you Deku. you’re 1000 years too early to ever land a hit on this guy
  • but it seems like he was able to activate the smash without doing himself any damage, at least
  • and it seems like Gran has stopped the fight now that he got to see Deku’s One for All in action
  • he’s like feeling up his arm omg
  • Deku is frustrated and says he thought he had him
  • but Gran says he saw how Deku fought in the sports fest
  • hmm??



  • whoa hold the phone. should I be mad?
  • I guess I’ll let him make his point first
  • so he says that Deku is concerned about getting stronger fast. and it’s true that his enemies won’t wait
  • oh shit



  • all of a sudden this is a fucking theme huh
  • so does he already know something about whoever’s behind Noumu, then? cuz it would be nice if he could fucking clue All Might and the rest of them in
  • (ETA: never mind I completely misread this. he’s not saying there are other One for All-type quirks, he’s saying One for All itself is still a quirk just like any other quirk.)
  • he’s so vague and annoying omg



  • SO HELPFUL. my god I miss All Might’s straightforward no-bullshit approach
  • (ETA: honestly, would it really have hindered Deku’s growth any if he’d just come out and told him straight, “STOP USING IT IN JUST ONE BODY PART AT A TIME AND USE IT ON YOUR WHOLE BODY ALL AT ONCE”? like, does Deku really gain anything here other than the satisfaction of having figured it out on his own? it’s not like he doesn’t already know how to think outside the box. but I guess I’ll defer to the wise old sensei here since it did work out okay in the end.)
  • and now he’s leaving to go buy food and making Deku clean his house while he ponders what Gran meant by his respect for All Might holding him back
  • MEANWHILE IT’S IIDA YAY
  • who’s this guy



  • (ETA: this is Manual, everyone, and he’s the best)
  • well whoever he is, apparently Iida’s out on patrol with him, which they’ve been doing regularly since the attacks began
  • what is this about the number of patrolmen being downsized? is it because they all got taken out by Stain?
  • Iida needs to get himself some contacts for when he’s fighting crime



  • speaking as someone who wore glasses for 20 damn years before finally making the switch (and also as someone who’s done martial arts both with and without them), it’s sooo freeing to have peripheral vision, and to not have to worry about the glasses slipping or getting fogged up or cutting up your face when you get punched
  • and if he’s not going to do contacts he should at least switch to sports glasses
  • anyway, apologies for that random nitpick and rest assured I am still loving the shit out of this Iida angst
  • a high school freshman thinking he can somehow take out a serial killer who’s murdered 17 pro heroes and maimed dozens of others and put even his own brother out of commission is the most shounen thing ever
  • AND ALL OF A SUDDEN WE CUT TO A GROUP OF VILLAINS HANGING OUT AT DR. NECK’S BAR



  • does he really have a human skull just sitting up there on the top shelf
  • so this is picking up from where we left off before with Kurogiri introducing himself to Stain
  • (ETA: okay, question… what exactly is the timeline here. like, we see Stain perched on that water tower and Kurogiri approaching him back in chapter 42 in the middle of the sports festival tournament. two days after that, the kids receive their draft picks, and are told their internships will start in a week. so this is now nine days after Kuro and Stain were shown to be chatting, and Kuro’s only just now introducing him to Tomura. then the two of them start arguing, and we cut back to Deku, and then the next fucking day we cut back to the villain bar again and we’re still somehow right where we left off? and then Stain tells Kurogiri to return him to Hosu, which he does, only by that point yet another day has passed and Deku’s now on night three of his internship. so basically, a total of 12 days somehow passes for Deku while all of this happens in like a fucking half hour for Stain? or are you telling me that the initial meeting with Kurogiri and Stain is actually supposed to take place a full 12 days after Stain attacked Ingenium, and he was just chilling out in Hosu City for almost two weeks and didn’t attack a single other person in all that time (because Iida confirms in chapter 49 that his brother was the only victim in Hosu)? because that doesn’t make much sense either. all I can conclude is that Stain somehow got himself caught in a fucking time warp at some point.)
  • and now Tomura is trying to recruit him. hey dude do you want to join our evil league of evil
  • Stain is flattered, probably, but still asking some pertinent questions. you can tell this isn’t his first job interview



  • so that’s one very specific goal, and one extremely vague and petty goal. covering all the bases
  • oh and he wants to kill Deku :’D
  • oh, but apparently Stain isn’t impressed by this answer. “you’re the type I hate the most”
  • (ETA: Tomura is really bad at this recruiting thing, isn’t he. things play out in almost the exact same way when he tries to recruit Bakugou later on)
  • he’s calling Tomura a tantrum-throwing child. he says bloodlust without conviction is meaningless
  • aaaaand now he’s drawing two of those bigass daggers from their holsters
  • Kuro is thinking to himself that he thought Stain might help Tomura grow the fuck up a little but apparently not. and he’s asking if he should stop Stain
  • – oh, he’s asking the Skype Villain
  • Skype Villain says it’s fine and that Stain must reach the right conclusions for himself
  • you’re goddamn lucky these guys can’t seem to get their shit together for longer than two seconds, Deku
  • speaking of Deku it’s back to Deku



  • yep, pretty much all the same things I’ve been wondering
  • apparently the idea of “loose” got him thinking a little bit
  • “!” well something seems to have clicked
  • “I was thinking of it as some super-secret, last-resort trump card.” well, that’s definitely true. I’ve made note of it before how he always makes every effort to solve problems without his quirk first
  • “quirks are just extensions of our bodies” hmm. so is he going to start utilizing it more? it’s true that the kids who’ve had quirks their whole lives use them almost without thought. Bakugou for instance uses his so regularly it’s almost like a part of his natural body language at this point



  • who is the “him” in this referring to? All Might?
  • (ETA: actually I think it’s probably Kacchan)
  • anyway, he seems to have arrived at the right conclusion, because Gran is just chilling right outside listening to him and he seems pleased! good job my little green son
  • AND HE FUCKING CONFIRMED THAT ALL MIGHT’S REAL NAME IS TOSHINORI OH MY GOD YESSSSSS. I LOVE IT
  • and that’s the chapter end!


BONUS:


  • “favorite things: being inactive” I feel a sudden surge of kinship with this man
  • dude is 3 feet 9 inches… actually taller than I thought lol
  • loving the boots
  • “some people will instantly recognize the Dagobah sensibility about him” [RAISES HAND] ESB IS MY SECOND-FAVORITE FILM OF ALL TIME, YOU’RE DAMN STRAIGHT I PICKED UP ON THAT RESEMBLANCE RIGHT AWAY
  • he’s straight up admitting this guy is Yoda I fucking can’t believe it. so great
  • (ETA: so it’s become pretty clear that Horikoshi’s Star Wars influence is almost as strong as his Marvel influence. like, even all the place names are pulled from Star Wars, which is so fucking cool. do I even have any other interests for this guy to draw inspiration from at this rate. just throw in a few more Nintendo references and I’m set for life dude.)

trail.content_raw:
Previously on BnHA: The kids selected hero agencies to intern with. Deku was drafted by All Might’s old sensei Gran Torino. Iida had a terrifying page of foreshadowing and it kind of scared me shitless. Deku arrived at Gran Torino’s rundown and possibly condemned building on day one of his internship. Gran trolled him Yoda-style for a few minutes and then when Deku was about to leave, he suddenly turned it all the way to eleven and was all COME AT ME.

Today on BnHA: All Might and Naomasa discuss Noumu. Deku spars with Gran and gets a quick ass-kicking and some advice. Iida patrols Hosu City. Stain and Tomura are formally introduced and immediately hate each other. Deku has part one of a two-part epiphany regarding how to use One for All.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 114 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

[[MORE]]


  • okay I’m relieved to see the chapter isn’t just going to be all about Deku fighting Gran, because as entertaining as I’m sure that will be, I still want to know what’s going on with the others and their internships and Iida and his angst and such
  • All Might is talking to his nice detective friend Naomasa!
  • and they’re talking about Noumu so immediately my interest is piqued
  • okay I shouldn’t find this image of Noumu all wrapped up like a burrito in this straitjacket so cute… but



  • there it is. all tucked into his lil snuggie there. cuz he’s evil
  • so apparently they ran a DNA test on Noumu since they couldn’t find anything from their other tests… and what?? he’s just some guy?!
  • holy shit they took some random petty criminal and fucking infused him with a bunch of other people’s DNA and turned him into this experiment
  • he’s been “bioengineered to tolerate multiple quirks” apparently, so his low brain activity is due to that
  • they can do that?!
  • hooooooooooly shit



  • HOLY SHIT SO MUCH TO PROCESS JUST FROM TWO SINGLE PANELS. HOLY FUCK
  1. NAO IS THE OTHER GUY WHO KNOWS ABOUT ONE FOR ALL
  2. some villain is out there transferring quirks to people and turning them into basically superpowered vegetables omg
  3. and the fact that they can do this implies that they know quite a lot about transferring quirks and they might have the ability to bestow quirks
  4. which means that the concept of “bestowing quirks” would be one they’re familiar with
  5. which makes this person potentially one of the only people out there capable of putting the pieces together with Deku and All Might. everyone else so far who’s noticed a connection has assumed it’s either coincidence, or that there might perhaps be some secret blood relation between them. because as far as they know, you can’t just give someone a quirk. but if someone out there did know that… Deku’s secret is pretty much laid out there for them. which potentially puts him in a whole fucking lot of danger!!
  • (ETA: yeah you’re damn right he put the pieces together with Deku and All Might lol. but I had no idea this guy’s ability would turn out to be so closely connected to One for All. honestly, this arc has its issues, but the worldbuilding here is off the fucking charts. basically the entire rest of the series gets set up in this arc.)
  • so yeah!! a lot to take in there! god damn!
  • also the idea that there are villains out there just kidnapping people and running these kind of experiments on them is really disturbing and also giving me so many fanfic ideas that I just have to push back down for now and hope that someone out there has already explored this. once I’m caught up I’m gonna go on the fanworks binge to end all binges omg
  • so now we’re back to Deku and Gran!
  • Gran says All Might doesn’t know shit about teaching, so it’s up to him to do the thing properly

  • anyway, Gran got bored of Deku’s nonsense and he’s now omae wa mou shindeiruing



  • aaaand he’s kicking him in the back
  • Deku is shocked that he’s actually fighting. he thought for some reason that it was just going to be a demonstration. I thought this kid was supposed to be obsessed with comic books. you should know the tropes better than this by now, Deku

  • well, you wanted this, Deku

  • uh oh

  • but it seems like he was able to activate the smash without doing himself any damage, at least

  • all of a sudden this is a fucking theme huh
  • so does he already know something about whoever’s behind Noumu, then? cuz it would be nice if he could fucking clue All Might and the rest of them in
  • (ETA: never mind I completely misread this. he’s not saying there are other One for All-type quirks, he’s saying One for All itself is still a quirk just like any other quirk.)
  • he’s so vague and annoying omg



  • SO HELPFUL. my god I miss All Might’s straightforward no-bullshit approach
  • (ETA: honestly, would it really have hindered Deku’s growth any if he’d just come out and told him straight, “STOP USING IT IN JUST ONE BODY PART AT A TIME AND USE IT ON YOUR WHOLE BODY ALL AT ONCE”? like, does Deku really gain anything here other than the satisfaction of having figured it out on his own? it’s not like he doesn’t already know how to think outside the box. but I guess I’ll defer to the wise old sensei here since it did work out okay in the end.)
  • and now he’s leaving to go buy food and making Deku clean his house while he ponders what Gran meant by his respect for All Might holding him back
  • MEANWHILE IT’S IIDA YAY
  • who’s this guy



  • (ETA: this is Manual, everyone, and he’s the best)
  • well whoever he is, apparently Iida’s out on patrol with him, which they’ve been doing regularly since the attacks began
  • what is this about the number of patrolmen being downsized? is it because they all got taken out by Stain?
  • Iida needs to get himself some contacts for when he’s fighting crime



  • speaking as someone who wore glasses for 20 damn years before finally making the switch (and also as someone who’s done martial arts both with and without them), it’s sooo freeing to have peripheral vision, and to not have to worry about the glasses slipping or getting fogged up or cutting up your face when you get punched
  • and if he’s not going to do contacts he should at least switch to sports glasses
  • anyway, apologies for that random nitpick and rest assured I am still loving the shit out of this Iida angst
  • a high school freshman thinking he can somehow take out a serial killer who’s murdered 17 pro heroes and maimed dozens of others and put even his own brother out of commission is the most shounen thing ever
  • AND ALL OF A SUDDEN WE CUT TO A GROUP OF VILLAINS HANGING OUT AT DR. NECK’S BAR



  • does he really have a human skull just sitting up there on the top shelf
  • so this is picking up from where we left off before with Kurogiri introducing himself to Stain
  • (ETA: okay, question… what exactly is the timeline here. like, we see Stain perched on that water tower and Kurogiri approaching him back in chapter 42 in the middle of the sports festival tournament. two days after that, the kids receive their draft picks, and are told their internships will start in a week. so this is now nine days after Kuro and Stain were shown to be chatting, and Kuro’s only just now introducing him to Tomura. then the two of them start arguing, and we cut back to Deku, and then the next fucking day we cut back to the villain bar again and we’re still somehow right where we left off? and then Stain tells Kurogiri to return him to Hosu, which he does, only by that point yet another day has passed and Deku’s now on night three of his internship. so basically, a total of 12 days somehow passes for Deku while all of this happens in like a fucking half hour for Stain? or are you telling me that the initial meeting with Kurogiri and Stain is actually supposed to take place a full 12 days after Stain attacked Ingenium, and he was just chilling out in Hosu City for almost two weeks and didn’t attack a single other person in all that time (because Iida confirms in chapter 49 that his brother was the only victim in Hosu)? because that doesn’t make much sense either. all I can conclude is that Stain somehow got himself caught in a fucking time warp at some point.)
  • and now Tomura is trying to recruit him. hey dude do you want to join our evil league of evil
  • Stain is flattered, probably, but still asking some pertinent questions. you can tell this isn’t his first job interview



  • so that’s one very specific goal, and one extremely vague and petty goal. covering all the bases
  • oh and he wants to kill Deku :’D
  • oh, but apparently Stain isn’t impressed by this answer. “you’re the type I hate the most”
  • (ETA: Tomura is really bad at this recruiting thing, isn’t he. things play out in almost the exact same way when he tries to recruit Bakugou later on)
  • he’s calling Tomura a tantrum-throwing child. he says bloodlust without conviction is meaningless
  • aaaaand now he’s drawing two of those bigass daggers from their holsters
  • Kuro is thinking to himself that he thought Stain might help Tomura grow the fuck up a little but apparently not. and he’s asking if he should stop Stain
  • – oh, he’s asking the Skype Villain
  • Skype Villain says it’s fine and that Stain must reach the right conclusions for himself
  • you’re goddamn lucky these guys can’t seem to get their shit together for longer than two seconds, Deku
  • speaking of Deku it’s back to Deku



  • yep, pretty much all the same things I’ve been wondering
  • apparently the idea of “loose” got him thinking a little bit
  • “!” well something seems to have clicked
  • “I was thinking of it as some super-secret, last-resort trump card.” well, that’s definitely true. I’ve made note of it before how he always makes every effort to solve problems without his quirk first
  • “quirks are just extensions of our bodies” hmm. so is he going to start utilizing it more? it’s true that the kids who’ve had quirks their whole lives use them almost without thought. Bakugou for instance uses his so regularly it’s almost like a part of his natural body language at this point



  • who is the “him” in this referring to? All Might?
  • (ETA: actually I think it’s probably Kacchan)
  • anyway, he seems to have arrived at the right conclusion, because Gran is just chilling right outside listening to him and he seems pleased! good job my little green son
  • AND HE FUCKING CONFIRMED THAT ALL MIGHT’S REAL NAME IS TOSHINORI OH MY GOD YESSSSSS. I LOVE IT
  • and that’s the chapter end!


BONUS:


  • “favorite things: being inactive” I feel a sudden surge of kinship with this man
  • dude is 3 feet 9 inches… actually taller than I thought lol
  • loving the boots
  • “some people will instantly recognize the Dagobah sensibility about him” [RAISES HAND] ESB IS MY SECOND-FAVORITE FILM OF ALL TIME, YOU’RE DAMN STRAIGHT I PICKED UP ON THAT RESEMBLANCE RIGHT AWAY
  • he’s straight up admitting this guy is Yoda I fucking can’t believe it. so great
  • (ETA: so it’s become pretty clear that Horikoshi’s Star Wars influence is almost as strong as his Marvel influence. like, even all the place names are pulled from Star Wars, which is so fucking cool. do I even have any other interests for this guy to draw inspiration from at this rate. just throw in a few more Nintendo references and I’m set for life dude.)
trail.content_abstract:
Previously on BnHA: The kids selected hero agencies to intern with. Deku was drafted by All Might’s old sensei Gran Torino. Iida had a terrifying page of foreshadowing and it kind of scared me shitless. Deku arrived at Gran Torino’s rundown and possibly condemned building on day one of his internship. Gran trolled him Yoda-style for a few minutes and then when Deku was about to leave, he suddenly turned it all the way to eleven and was all COME AT ME.

Today on BnHA: All Might and Naomasa discuss Noumu. Deku spars with Gran and gets a quick ass-kicking and some advice. Iida patrols Hosu City. Stain and Tomura are formally introduced and immediately hate each other. Deku has part one of a two-part epiphany regarding how to use One for All.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 114 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)
